active_learning.discussion_prompt: To what extent should penetration testers use social media profiling? Debate the ethical boundaries, privacy concerns vs. security benefits, using real-world examples like celebrity hacks (e.g., Twitter account compromises) or corporate breaches (e.g., LinkedIn data used in spear-phishing campaigns).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking. Generate 25 high-quality flashcards on 'Social Media Profiling (LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter)' in the domain hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Penetration Testing And Ethical Hacking > Social Engineering Testing > 002_Information Gathering and Reconnaissance > Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT) > Social Media Profiling. **Topic Content (Full Synthesized):** Social media profiling is passive OSINT reconnaissance aggregating public data from LinkedIn (professional: jobs, connections), Facebook (personal: family, events, photos), Twitter (opinions, real-time activity) to build target profiles for social engineering. Categories: Personal (routines, interests); Professional (history, colleagues); Technical (OS/software mentions, e.g., 'Using macOS Ventura and Wireshark'); Connections (networks). Ethical: Public data only, fictional practice. Vectors: Phishing via hobbies/colleagues. Sources: sentinelone.com/blog/osint-social-media-profiling/, osintframework.com, linkedin.com/learning/osint. **Incorporate:** - Learning Objectives: [Paste full list from JSON] - Scaffolding Layers: [Paste full descriptions from JSON] (5-7 cards per layer) - Active Learning: Tie cards to discussion/activities (e.g., scenario cards for problem-solving) - Ensure 40% REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, 30% APPLY/ANALYZE, 30% EVALUATE/CREATE **Output Format:** JSON array of 25 flashcards, each as: {"front": "...", "back": {"answer": "...", "explanation": "...", "distractors": ["...","...","..."]}, "metadata": {...}}. Strictly follow flashcard_schema. Vary types: 10 definitions, 10 MCQ, 5 application scenarios. Emphasize ethics, completeness (technical info included).
